name: Noah Adebayo
description:
Noah Adebayo is a 29-year-old career switcher moving from product analytics into UX research, based in Austin, Texas. Methodical and curious, he treats his job search like a product discovery cycle: he frames hypotheses about target companies, runs small experiments (cold outreach, portfolio tweaks, mock interviews), measures conversion rates, and iterates weekly. He aims for mission-driven fintech or health-tech teams where research influences roadmaps, with a preference for hybrid work and a manager who mentors. 

Noah keeps a living knowledge base of companies, roles, and contacts in Notion and Airtable, linking each posting to tailored STAR stories, relevant case studies, and a role scorecard (mission fit, manager signal, learning potential, and compensation). He tailors every application for ATS alignment without sounding generic, using AI only for first drafts and then rewriting to reflect his voice and evidence. He schedules two informational interviews per week, sends concise debriefs with insights, and maintains a “win folder” of positive feedback to counter rejection fatigue. 

He’s organized but warm: empathetic in interviews, patient with stakeholders, and a clear communicator who summarizes findings visually. To manage stress, Noah runs, boulders, and practices a short mindfulness routine. He values accessibility, ethical research, and community—contributing to open-source and volunteering as a resume reviewer. Constraints include a modest budget during the search and caregiving on select evenings, so he relies on structured sprints, deep work blocks, and high-quality, low-volume applications.
example_behaviours: Runs a Sunday evening “opportunity sprint” to shortlist five roles and deeply tailor two applications for the week.
Builds a role scorecard for each posting, weighting mission fit, manager signal, learning potential, and compensation.
Schedules two informational interviews weekly and sends 24-hour follow-up summaries with specific takeaways.
Maintains a Notion database linking job posts to STAR stories, portfolio artifacts, and outreach status.
Conducts Wednesday mock interviews with an accountability partner, rotating between behavioral and case prompts.
Tracks application funnel metrics (views → interviews → offers) and runs monthly retrospectives on what to improve.
Contributes 2 hours/week to an open-source nonprofit, running lightweight usability tests and documenting insights.
Uses a 25/5 Pomodoro cadence to draft bespoke cover letters, followed by a voice-read edit pass for tone and clarity.
Hosts a monthly “portfolio teardown” night at a local UX meetup for peer feedback.
Keeps a “win folder” of positive feedback and reviews it after rejections to maintain morale.
Boulders twice a week for stress relief and problem-solving practice; logs climbs like mini research puzzles.
Cooks plant-forward Nigerian–Korean fusion dishes on Fridays as a creative reset and shares recipes with friends.
